creditline: Gift of Leo A. and Doris Hodroff
description: vase, one of a garniture of five, lobed bodies, flared necks, painted baskets of flowers, squirrels, berried vines and roses in colored relief
medium: Porcelain with enamel and gilded decoration
text: During the seventeenth century, particularly in Holland, it became fashionable to embellish mirrors and fireplace surrounds with porcelain vases and figures, often displayed on individual brackets or stands. These groups of vases, called garnitures, remained a popular form of interior decoration throughout the eighteenth and into the nineteenth century. The size and number of pieces in a garniture (from three to seven or more vases) depended on the decorative effect desired.
title: Vase, one of a garniture of five
